title.narrative: OUTPUT 4.3: HARMFUL PRACTICES PREVENTION AND RESPONSE

description.narrative: Output 4.3: By 2026, All children, including adolescents, families and their communities, have increased knowledge and understanding of violence against children and women and are empowered to prevent violence and other harmful practices, including in climate-affected locations and other humanitarian settings., which contributes to Prevention Of Harmful Practice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Risk-Informed Humanitarian And Development Nexus Programming, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 4 - Child Protection: By 2026, all children, including adolescents, are better protected from all forms of violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect and harmful traditional practices

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents
